senses.ex: Despite the heavy rain, the game continued.

Tips.title: Action Persistence
Tips.description: Used when actions or activities persist despite challenges or changes.
Tips.example: She continued reading even as the lights dimmed.

Tips.title: With Adverbs
Tips.description: Often paired with adverbs to describe the manner of continuation, such as 'quietly' or 'steadily'.
Tips.example: They continued quietly discussing the issue.

senses.de: to stay in the same situation or condition

Tips.title: State Stability
Tips.description: Emphasizes stability or lack of change in a situation, condition, or state over time.
Tips.example: The weather continued to be sunny all week.

Tips.title: Progressive Improvement
Tips.description: Indicates ongoing positive change, often related to health, performance, or quality.
Tips.example: His grades continued to rise throughout the semester.

senses.de: to carry on a lawsuit or other legal process
senses.ex: The attorney decided to continue the case.

Tips.title: Legal Continuation
Tips.description: Specific to legal context, referring to the progression of legal proceedings or actions.
Tips.example: The judge granted a motion to continue the trial to a later date.

Tips.title: Case Duration
Tips.description: Can imply the lengthening of legal action or delay in reaching a conclusion.
Tips.example: Due to new evidence, we will continue our investigation.

senses.de: to extend in a particular direction
senses.ex: The path continues for another mile.

Tips.title: Physical Extension
Tips.description: Describes something physical, such as a path or road, extending from one point to another.
Tips.example: The highway continues beyond the city limits.

Tips.title: Directional Use
Tips.description: Can indicate direction of extension, often used with prepositions like 'to', 'into', 'through'.
Tips.example: The forest continues into the mountains.

Carry on.wordDefinition:
The words carry on and continue are very similar in meaning, but there is a slight difference between the two.

Continue means to keep doing something that you were already doing, without any interruptions or changes. For example, if you were reading a book and someone enters the room and leaves, you would continue reading after they leave.

Carry on also means to keep doing something, but usually implies a situation where there have been interruptions or distractions.

For example, if you were having a conversation with someone and then someone else interrupts, you might say "let's carry on with our conversation" to signal that you want to continue, even though you were interrupted.

Continue is more straightforward and can be used in most situations where you want to say that you're going to keep doing something.

Carry on is more specific and usually implies a situation where you are continuing despite interruptions or distractions.

Endure.wordDefinition:
Endure means to go through something difficult or painful while trying to remain strong or patient. It is applicable when talking about situations that require resilience or perseverance, such as enduring a difficult illness or enduring hardships in life.

Continue means to keep going, while endure means to keep going despite hardships or difficulties.

Go on.wordDefinition:
The words continue and go on have very similar meanings, but they can be used in slightly different contexts.

Continue is typically used when you want to say that you're going to keep doing something that you've already started. For example, if you're studying for a test and someone interrupts you, you might say "I'm going to continue studying after you leave" to indicate that you plan to pick up where you left off.

Go on, on the other hand, can be used in a couple of different ways.

It can be used as an encouragement to someone who is telling a story or trying to explain something: "Go on, I'm listening."

It can also be used to mean "keep happening" or "keep moving forward." For example, you might say "The meeting went on for three hours" to indicate that it lasted a long time.

Overall, both words can be used to indicate that something is going to keep happening or that someone is going to continue doing something, but continue is typically used in more formal contexts, while go on is more casual and can be used in a broader range of situations.

Maintain.wordDefinition:
Maintain, on the other hand, means to keep something in a particular state or condition. For example, if you say "I need to maintain my car regularly so it doesn't break down," this means you should keep your car in good condition by regularly servicing it.

Both words are applicable in different contexts. Continue is useful when talking about ongoing activities, while maintain is useful when talking about keeping something in a certain state or condition over time.

Persevere.wordDefinition:
Persevere implies that you're facing some kind of challenge or obstacle and that you're determined to overcome it.

For example, you might say "I'm going to persevere in my studies of Spanish, even if it's difficult" if you're struggling with the language but still want to achieve a certain level of proficiency.

So to summarize: continue means to keep doing something, while persevere means to keep doing something in spite of obstacles or challenges.

Persist.wordDefinition:
Persist means to keep trying even when faced with difficulties or obstacles.

It is used in situations where someone is determined to achieve something despite setbacks. For example, "She persisted in her efforts to learn the piano, even though it was difficult" means that she didn't give up on learning the piano even when it was challenging.

Continue refers to an action being carried out without interruption, while persist refers to someone's determination to pursue a goal despite obstacles.

Proceed.wordDefinition:
Proceed means to move forward or to begin something.

For example, if you were finished one part of the project and now moving on to the next part, you would proceed to the next task.

Continue is used when you want to keep doing something you have already started, while proceed is used when you want to move forward to a new task or step.

Sustain.wordDefinition:
Sustain means to support, nourish, or maintain something over time. For example, if you are growing plants, you need to sustain them by giving them enough water and sunlight to grow properly.

Continue is applicable when we want something to keep going without interruption, while sustain is applicable when we want something to continue for a longer period of time and require support or nourishment to keep it going.

quotes.Text: A lot of times, people feel that if they forgive the person who hurt them, then they will continue to take advantage of them or not take responsibility for what they did wrong.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Joyce Meyer

quotes.Text: Love can no more continue without a constant motion than fire can; and when once you take hope and fear away, you take from it its very life and being.
quotes.Title: French Writer
quotes.Name: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.Text: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
quotes.Title: French Philosopher
quotes.Name: Albert Camus

quotes.Text: I want to continue to produce film, television, and theater, and to make the most amazing music that I've made in my life.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Alicia Keys

quotes.Text: I've known and continue to know every one of these major world leaders by their first names, and I have access to them.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Joe Biden

quotes.Text: Disneyland will never be completed. It will continue to grow as long as there is imagination left in the world.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Walt Disney

quotes.Text: If you're here right now in your life, your journey continues and you've lived to tell the story.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Mary J. Blige

quotes.Text: I would prefer to just continue to speak about truth and to speak about what makes sense.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Ben Carson

quotes.Text: Expect me to continue what I've been doing, which is trying to take over the world.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Kevin Hart

quotes.Text: Reality continues to ruin my life.
quotes.Title: American Cartoonist
quotes.Name: Bill Watterson
